review: I didn't consider owning a smart streaming TV device until I heard that Google's Chromecast had launched its "Google Cast" extension on google chrome browser, which allows the user to stream anything on any tab (video or website) onto their TV screen. Although it's still in beta, it works perfectly fine with my computer and TV. All one needs to do is make sure your graphics card is at least mid-level and your wifi is strong enough (20Mbps and up).The usability on Google's chromecast is nice and simple. I can use my phone to control it through chromecast supported apps, or I can easily broadcast from my laptop and desktop using the google cast extension or even easier through websites of apps (post tv, netflix, etc).For the price I don't think you can go wrong, and you get directly what is advertised. An affordable streaming option that is sure to get even better as it continues to be developed and more companies make apps for the device (which is now even easier since google made its code public).The only qualms I have for the device is that it is hard to set up if your router or modem is not on the supported list (available on their website). Mine wasn't, but I still managed to get mine set up. The fact that it is only guaranteed to work with certain ones needs to be fixed.Also, currently chromecast only streams 720p with the cast extension - in a 1080p age this should be the standard!. It could also use more stock supported apps, which I'm sure will come in time.Otherwise this device would be a 5star product.
author: Jonathan Martin
